repository.corpname: Marist College Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The McCann Postcard Collection consists of a series of postcards from the friends and family of the McCann’s around the world from the years 1901- 1908 as well as a book on a car’s transcontinental journey.
did.physloc: Please contact the Marist College Archives and Special Collections for information regarding use and access of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The McCann Postcard Collection consists of various postcards sent to Agnes and her family between 1901 and 1908 and a book describing the transcontinental journey of the Mitchell Ranger.

acqinfo.p: The McCann Postcard Collection was loaned to Marist College by John Gartland Jr.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Agnes McCann lived with her family in Poughkeepsie, New York. Her brother, James J. McCann, took over the family feed and grain store and made millions investing in the stock market. James McCann became a philanthropist donating money to the local community and establishing the McCann Foundation which continues to help the community. Agnes and her sister Mary traveled extensively and the postcard collection reflects correspondence between themselves, their family, and friends.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection

userestrict.head: Notice of Copyright
userestrict.p: Individuals requesting reproductions expressly assume the responsibility for compliance with all pertinent provisions of the Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. ss101 et seq. Patrons further agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Marist College Archives and Special Collections and its staff in connection with any disputes arising from the Copyright Act, over the reproduction of material at the request of patrons. For more information please visit the following website: http://www.loc.gov/copyright/title17/.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description of item, date, location of item in order of series, box number, folder number ], in the McCann Postcard Collection, Archives and Special Collections, James A. Cannavino Library, Marist College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: These records are organized into two series: 1) Postcards collected by Agnes McCann and 2) Miscellaneous

scopecontent.p: Series contains a collection of 420 postcards saved by Agnes McCann. Postcards are arranged in original order as found in the album, where they were displayed, with six postcards to a page.

scopecontent.p: Series contains a book, From Ocean to Ocean, distributed by the Mitchell Motor Car Company, which describes how a car, The Mitchell Ranger, carried the First Transcontinental War Dispatch. From Major- General Leonard Wood in New York to Major- General John F. Weston in San Francisco.

did.unittitle: From Ocean to Ocean: How The Mitchell Ranger carried the First Transcontinental War Dispatch. Racine, Wisconsin: The Mitchell Motor Car Company.
